natural problem:
Find the minimum value of
\[17 \log_{30} x - 3 \log_x 5 + 20 \log_x 15 - 3 \log_x 6 + 20 \log_x 2\]for $x > 1.$
natural solution: &= 17 \log_{30} x + \log_x (2^{17} \cdot 3^{17} \cdot 5^{17}) \\ &= 17 \log_{30} x + 17 \log_x 30 \\ &= 17 \left( \log_{30} x + \frac{1}{\log_{30} x} \right). \end{align}By AM-GM, \[\log_{30} x + \frac{1}{\log_{30} x} \ge 2,\]so $17 \left( \log_{30} x + \frac{1}{\log_{30} x} \right) \ge 34.$  Equality occurs when $x = 30,$ so the minimum value is $\boxed{34}.$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and log :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "x > 1"
and h1 : "log b x = ln x / ln b"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. f x = 17 * log 30 x - 3 * log x 5 + 20 * log x 15 - 3 * log x 6 + 20 * log x 2"
shows  "f x = (LEAST a. \<exists> x. f x = a)"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem

\[17 \log_{30} x - 3 \log_x 5 + 20 \log_x 15 - 3 \log_x 6 + 20 \log_x 2\]for $x > 1.$ The final Answer is 34
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} &17 \log_{30} x - 3 \log_x 5 + 20 \log_x 15 - 3 \log_x 6 + 20 \log_x 2 \\ &= 17 \log_{30} x - \log_x 5^3 + \log_x 15^{20} - \log_x 6^3 + \log_x 2^{20} \\ &= 17 \log_{30} x + \log_x \frac{15^{20} \cdot 2^{20}}{5^3 \cdot 6^3} \\

 *)

a_9.formal problem:
Unfortunately, logarithm operations in Isabelle/Isar do not have a built-in simplification or evaluation mechanism for real numbers, and constraints over real numbers are not well supported. You would need to define your own functions or use an external library that provides this functionality. However, a rough translation of your problem could look like this:

definition log_base :: "real ⇒ real ⇒ real" where
"log_base b a = (ln a / ln b)"

theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x > 1"
shows  "let f = (\<lambda>x. 17 * log_base 30 x - 3 * log_base x 5 + 20 * log_base x 15 - 3 * log_base x 6 + 20 * log_base x 2) in
        (LEAST y. \<exists>x. f x = y) = 34"

Please note that this is only a rough translation and it will not evaluate or simplify in Isabelle due to the limitations mentioned above. You would need a more advanced environment or library that supports operations on real numbers, such as the HOL Light or HOL4 theorem provers.
